key_insights.primary_message: The chart shows the projected decomposition of supercore PCE inflation from 2023 through early 2026, with pre-pandemic contribution levels shown as reference points
notable_patterns: Total supercore PCE inflation shows a gradual decline from about 5 percentage points in early 2023 to around 3 percentage points by 2026
Other Services (which includes housing) consistently make the largest contribution to inflation
Financial Services & Insurance contributions increase over time as a share of total inflation
Health Care contributions remain significant throughout the projection period
Food Services & Transportation Services contributions decline relative to their 2023 levels
key_insights.policy_relevance: The projection shows inflation gradually converging toward pre-pandemic levels, but remaining above those levels through early 2026, suggesting persistent inflationary pressures in service categories.

interpretation_guidance.reading_the_chart: Each colored bar segment represents the contribution of a service category to overall supercore PCE inflation, measured in percentage points. The stacked bars sum to the total supercore PCE inflation. The vertical line and values at 2026 represent pre-pandemic contribution levels for comparison.
key_comparisons: Compare projected 2026 values with the pre-pandemic contribution levels shown at the far right
Note the changing composition of services inflation over time
Observe the persistence of inflation across service categories
interpretation_guidance.limitations: This chart shows a forecast/projection and actual results may differ. The categorization groups many detailed subcomponents into broader categories.
